signature: TransformedMultiValuedMap<K, V> transformedMap(MultiValuedMap<K, V>, Transformer<? super K, ? extends K>, Transformer<? super V, ? extends V>)

direct_enhancements.method_name: transformingMap(MultiValuedMap<K, V>, Transformer<? super K, ? extends K>, Transformer<? super V, ? extends V>)
direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods create a transformed MultiValuedMap, but transformedMap applies transformations to existing elements, while transformingMap does not.
The transformedMap method relies on the put method to insert transformed key-value pairs into the map.
The transformedMap method indirectly uses putAll to add multiple values to a key after transformation.
The transformedMap method relies on the transformKey method to transform keys before insertion.
The transformedMap method relies on the transformValue method to transform values before insertion.
The transformedMap method uses ArrayListValuedHashMap to create a copy of the original map, indicating similar resource access patterns.
